question:
Some people say that the best way to improve public health is by increasing the number of sports facilities. Others, however, say that this would have little effect on public health and that other measures are required.

Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
text: Some individuals believe that the perfect way to improve everyone’s health is by introducing more sports facilities. While many others argue that the move will show a little effect on people’s wellbeing and suggests that other measures are required. In my opinion, just by increasing the number of sports complexes will not yield the desired outcomes

Increasing the number of sports centers will have a positive impact on the public health condition, but that particular step alone wouldn’t be useful if other measures are not considered. Even though if we are physically active for 7 days a week and if we are not eating healthy, it will not give us expected results. Let’s say, if I work out for 60 mins in a day and eat two big chicken burgers, it does not make any sense, I’m compensating the workout with excess calories. Food habits play a vital role in the public health.

Sports arenas in combination with increased awareness among the public about good health and food habits will provide the best possible results. They are inseparable, good end result can’t be achieved without anyone of them.  Let us consider a scenario where I workout 60 mins in a day and eat good healthy food all the time, it the best combo to maintain the healthy body.

To conclude, I believe that ramping up the number of sports arenas alone will not improve public health drastically. It has to be done in combination with other aspects like public awareness on healthy life style and good eating routines.

error_list.error: an area that is approximately central within some larger region
